medis.Telescope.aberrations module¶

medis.Telescope.aberrations.abs_zeros(wf_array)¶

zeros everything outside the pupil

medis.Telescope.aberrations.add_aber(wf_array, f_lens, aber_params, aber_vals, step=0, Loc='CPA')¶
medis.Telescope.aberrations.add_atmos(wf_array, f_lens, w, atmos_map, correction=False)¶

creates a phase offset matrix for each wavelength at each time step, sampled from the atmosphere generated by CAOS

Parameters:
  • wf_array – array of complex E-field arrays at each wavelength for each astronomical body
  • f_lens –
  • w – discreet wavelength
  • atmos_map – fits file of atmospheric aberrations at time step
  • correction –
Returns:
medis.Telescope.aberrations.add_zern_ab(wfo)¶

adds low-order aberrations from Zernike polynomials

see good example in Proper manual pg 51 quote: These [polynomials] form an orthogonal set of aberrations that include:

wavefront tilt, defocus, coma, astigmatism, spherical aberration, and others

medis.Telescope.optics_propagate module¶

This code handles most of the telescope optics based functionality

medis.Telescope.optics_propagate.iter_func(wavefronts, func, *args, **kwargs)¶
medis.Telescope.optics_propagate.optics_propagate(empty_lamda, grid_size, PASSVALUE)¶

propagates instantaneous complex E-field through the optical system in loop over wavelength range

this function is called as a ‘perscription’ by proper

uses PyPROPER3 to generate the complex E-field at the source, then propagates it through atmosphere, then telescope, to the focal plane currently: optics system “hard coded” as single aperture and lens the AO simulator happens here this does not include the observation of the wavefront by the detector :returns spectral cube at instantaneous time
